Quickly and easily convert hash functions and number systems.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FrvGG1JhEe7Y7zMzcTDP5ThMj49hpcLxL

Operations are supported:

- HEX to BYTE array
- BYTE array to HEX
- DEC to HEX
- HEX to DEC
- DEC to OCT
- DEC to BIN
- BIN to DEC
- Hash SHA-1
- Hash SHA-3
- Hash SHA-224
- Hash SHA-256
- Hash SHA-384
- Hash SHA-512
- Hash MD5
- Hash RIPEMD-160
- Base64 Encode
- Base64 Decode
- Base58 Encode
- Base58 Decode
- AES Encrypt
- AES Decrypt
- DES Encrypt
- DES Decrypt
- 3DES Encrypt
- 3DES Decrypt
- Rabbit Encrypt
- Rabbit Decrypt
- RC4 Encrypt
- RC4 Decrypt
- CRC32
- SHA256 File HASH sums checker

SmartHoldem Light Wallet in ZeroNet  http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Ed8X9VsorSWEeYdgbZtjRV4v6ijv6qAdH

This is a cryptocurrency based on Delegate Proof-of-Stake (DPoS).

- Provides very fast transaction confirmation (1-8 sec)
- No need to download the blockchain, all operations are available immediately anywhere in the world
- This currency is also the core asset of the decentralized crypto exchange https://xbts.io
- Protection against attack 51, unlike previous generations crypto coins
- BFT algorithm
- Available connection to the wallet through onion-nodes (tor browser)
- Standard nodes are available via chrome

Desktop open source version here https://github.com/smartholdem/smartholdem-wallet/releases/tag/1.1.0

comment.body:
Secure offline more crypto wallets generator now in ZeroNet 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1FN1hP5SUaNg2uwnM7SJkA4vvht2MFquB4

@SSDifnskdjfnsdjk: 

Any user can raise his own node with a full blockchain, but this is not necessary here, and this opportunity expands the scope of use, thanks to fast speed, you can pay for coffee in a maximum of 8 seconds, without having to keep a full blockchain at hand.


This is one of the options Proof-of-Stake based on 64 independent delegates (fast nodes) for which network users vote. 64 nodes sign blocks, this is many times more than 5 centralized bitcoin mining pools. 64 top nodes are assigned and removed by network users. 


Outside the list of the top 64, there are also other independent nodes, their number is unlimited. As is well known in a conventional peer to peer peer network, transaction processing speed can be measured by the speed of the slowest node. 


Here, users decide who will sign the blocks, unlike mining pools, where ordinary users do not have the opportunity to choose.


The first project to prove the viability of this approach was bitshares
Recommend read this https://bitshares.gitbooks.io/bitshares101/content/


Yes, this is not ideal, technologies are developing.
